page.title: 16OCCUPATIONS IN BURRA
page.content: A SURVEY WAS DONE OF THE JOBS DONE BY MOTHERS AND FATHERS OF CHILDREN IN THE SCHOOL.JUST OVER HALF THE MEN WORKED IN THE FISHING INDUSTRY MOST AS FISHERMEN. THE NEXT BIGGEST EMPLOYER WAS THE OIL INDUSTRY WITH 13 ,FOLLOWED BY 4 WORIKNG FOR THE COUNCIL, 4 IN BUILDING AND 4 IN OTHER INDUSTRIES. TWO WERE TAXI DRIVERS,AND THE CHURCH AND NATURE CONSERVANCY EACH EMPLOYED ONE. ONE DAD WAS A MERCHANT SEAMAN,ONCE A VERY POPULAR OCCUPATION IN SHETLAND. FEMALE OCCUPATIONS WERE RATHER DIFFERENT AS MOST WOMEN WHO WORKED DID NOT NEED TO LEAVE THE ISLAND.JUST UNDER HALF WERE HOUSEWIVES.TEN WORKED FOR THE COUNCIL,MOSTLY IN THE SCHOOL.7 WERE SHOPWORKERS, 5 IN THE FISH FACTORY AND ONLY 1 IN THE OIL INDUSTRY. MANY WOMEN DO OCCASIONAL WORK AND MANY KNIT AT HOME.
